The Dreadfort is a fortress in the North and the seat of House Bolton in northeastern Westeros. Located on the banks of the upper Weeping Water, it is southeast of the Lonely Hills and north of the Sheepshead Hills. The Dreadfort is north of Hornwood, south of Last Hearth, and southwest of Karhold.
Drennan is an ironborn raider.

Drogo is a powerful khal or warlord of the fearsome Dothraki nomads. Daenerys Targaryen is promised to him in the beginning of the novels. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones Drogo is played by Jason Momoa.

The Drowned God, also known as He Who Dwells Beneath the Waves, is a sea deity worshiped solely by the ironborn of the Iron Islands in Westeros. The religion of the Drowned God is old, dating back to before the Andal invasion. Most Andal invaders of the Iron Islands converted to the local religion rather than supplant it with the Seven as they did in the south of Westeros. The Drowned God religion supports the ironmen's naval, pirate culture.
Dryn is a son of Tormund Giantsbane. He is about the same age as Bran.
Ser Dudley was a knight. He was slain in the Riverlands during the War of the Five Kings by House Lannister forces.<ref>A Storm of Swords, Chapter 34, Arya</ref>
Ser Dunaver is a knight in service to House Lannister.

Prince Duncan Targaryen, also known as Prince Duncan the Small and the Prince of Dragonflies, was a member of House Targaryen. He was the first son of King Aegon V Targaryen and his Queen Betha Blackwood,
Dunsen is a man-at-arms in service to Ser Gregor Clegane.
Dunstan Drumm, also known as the Drumm, is head of House Drumm, Lord of Old Wyk, and captain of the Thunderer.
Duram Bar Emmon is the Lord of Sharp Point and head of House Bar Emmon.

King Durran, also known as Durran Godsgrief, was the mythic first Storm King and the founder of House Durrandon. Legend has that he was married to Elenei, the daughter of the sea god and was the creator of Storm's End.
Dyah is a wildling. She was the wife and daughter of Craster.
Dykk Harlaw is an ironborn raider from House Harlaw.
Dywen is a veteran ranger of the Night's Watch.
Eastwatch-by-the-Sea is the easternmost castle along the Wall, located on a grey, windswept shore by the Bay of Seals.

The commander of Eastwatch is Cotter Pyke, while its maester is Harmune. The Night's Watch keeps several galleys at Eastwatch, including larger vessels capable of crossing the narrow sea and lean fighting vessels. The galleys patrol the Bay of Seals in part to catch smugglers who trade weapons to the wildlings. Ships stationed at Eastwatch include the Talon, the Blackbird, and the Storm Crow.
Easy is a steward of the Night's Watch. He is half-mad, believing himself to be Florian the Fool reborn.
Ebben<ref>He is called "Eggen" in the appendices. A Storm of Swords, Appendix</ref> is a veteran ranger of the Night's Watch stationed at the Shadow Tower.
Ebrose is the archmaester at the Citadel who tests novices seeking their link in the arts of healing.
Eddara Tallhart is the daughter of Ser Helman Tallhart.
Eddard Karstark, affectionately called Edd by his sister Alys, is the second son of Lord Rickard Karstark.

Eddard Stark, also called "Ned", is the head of House Stark, Lord of Winterfell, and Warden of the North. He is a close friend to King Robert I Baratheon, with whom he was raised. Eddard is one of the major POV characters in the books. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones, he is played by Sean Bean in Season 1 and by Sebastian Croft and Robert Aramayo during flashbacks in Season 6.<ref name=IMDB />
King Edderion Stark, better known as Edderion the Bridegroom, was King in the North and Lord of Winterfell. He is buried in the crypts beneath Winterfell.
Eddison Tollet, better known as Dolorous Edd, is a squire from House Tollett and a steward of the Night's Watch. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Ben Crompton.
Ser Eden Risley was a knight of House Risley during the reign of King Aerys I Targaryen.

Lord Edgerran Oakheart, better known as Lord Edgerran the Open-Handed, was a former Lord of Old Oak and head of House Oakheart. There is a tapestry of him at Old Oak depicting him sitting with a hundred Dornishmen heads piled around his feet.
Ser Edmund Ambrose is a knight of House Ambrose.

Ser Edmure Tully is the son of Lord Hoster Tully and Lady Minisa Whent, and the heir to House Tully of Riverrun, the liege lords of the riverlands. He is the younger brother of Catelyn and Lysa. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Tobias Menzies.<ref name=IMDB/>
Edmyn Tully was Lord of Riverrun and head of House Tully during Aegon's Conquest.
Edric Dayne, also known as Ned, is the Lord of Starfall and head of House Dayne. His father, whose name is unknown, was the elder brother of Ser Arthur, Lady Ashara, and Lady Allyria Dayne.
Edric Storm is the bastard son of King Robert I Baratheon and Delena Florent.
Edrick Stark, known as Edrick Snowbeard, was a King in the North and Lord of Winterfell from House Stark.
Ser Edwyd Fossoway is a knight from House Fossoway of Cider Hall.
Edwyle Stark was Lord of Winterfell and head of House Stark. The only son of Lord Willam Stark and Lady Melantha Blackwood. Edwyle married Lady Marna Locke and had only one child; Rickard.

Edwyn Frey is the eldest son of Ser Ryman Frey, grandson to Ser Stevron Frey and great-grandson of Lord Walder Frey. He stands to inherit the Twins, although the long lifespan of the members of his family and the pretensions of his dangerous brother Black Walder pose a threat to his birthright.
Edwyn Osgrey was a knight of House Osgrey during the reign of Daeron II Targaryen. The eldest son of Ser Eustace Osgrey.
King Edwyn Stark, better known as Edwyn the Spring King, was a King in the North and  Lord of Winterfell.
Eggon is an armsman in service to Ser Gregor Clegane.
Eglantine is a septa of the Faith of the Seven. She is the personal septa of Princess Myrcella Baratheon.
Egon Emeros, also known as Egon Emeros the Exquisite, is a member of the Pureborn of Qarth.
Princess Elaena Targaryen was the third daughter and youngest child of King Aegon III Targaryen and his wife, Queen Daenaera Velaryon.
Ser Elbert Arryn was a knight of House Arryn and nephew of Lord Jon Arryn. At the time of his death he was the heir to the Vale.
The Elder Brother is the leader of the community on the Quiet Isle. He is reputed to have powers as a healer.
Eldiss was an ironborn sailor. He had a brother, Skyte.
Ser Eldon Estermont is a knight of House Estermont. He is around seventy years old.
Eldred Codd is an ironborn raider and a member of House Codd.
Eleanor Mooton is the eldest daughter of Lord William Mooton of Maidenpool. She has at least two brothers and an unknown number of sisters.
Eleyna Westerling<ref>Eleyna's name is misspelled as Elenya in A Storm of Swords-Chapter 14.</ref> is a member of House Westerling, the youngest daughter of Lord Gawen Westerling and Sybell Spicer.

Princess Elia Nymeros Martell, also known simply as Elia Martell, was a Dornish princess from House Martell. She was married to the crown prince, Rhaegar Targaryen, and by him birthed Rhaenys and Aegon. Elia was raped and murdered by Ser Gregor Clegane during the Sack of King's Landing.

Elia Sand is the oldest bastard daughter of Prince Oberyn Martell by his paramour Ellaria Sand. She is one of the famous 'Sand Snakes'. She's fond of horses and jousting, her weapon of choice is the lance.<ref name=sample>The Winds of Winter, Arianne I, sample chapter</ref> Elia was most likely named after her late aunt, Elia Martell.

Elinor Tyrell is a member of a junior branch of House Tyrell. She is willowy and witty. She is a woman, having had her first bleeding. She is betrothed to Alyn Ambrose, who wore her favor during the Battle of the Blackwater.

Ellaria Sand is the beloved paramour of Prince Oberyn Martell, and the mother of the four youngest "Sand Snakes," Oberyn's bastard daughters. Ellaria herself is the bastard daughter of Lord Harmen Uller, a nobleman of Dorne. Ellaria is referred to as worshiping a Lysene love goddess, and was also described by Oberyn as being sexually adventurous and potentially bisexual.
Ser Ellery Vance is a member of House Vance of Atranta. He has four brothers; Ser Ronald, Ser Hugo, Kirth and Maester Jon.
Elmar Frey is a member of House Frey and is the youngest son of Lord Walder Frey. Elmar is the twenty-second-born son of Walder and the fourth son born of Walder's marriage to Annara Farring.
Elron is a ranger of the Night's Watch.
Elwood is a guard at Riverrun.
Elwood Meadows is the Lord of Grassy Vale and head of House Meadows. He is a cousin of the Fossoways.
Elyana Vypren is a member of House Vypren, a daughter of Lord Lucias Vypren. She is married to Ser Jon Wylde and has one child, Rickard Wylde.
Elyas Willum is the son of Lord Willum. He has one brother, Josua.
Elyn Norridge is a member of House Norridge and the wife of Ser Luthor Tyrell. They have three children, Ser Theodore, Olene and Medwick Tyrell.
Ser Elys  Waynwood was a knight of House Waynwood. The uncle of Lady Anya Waynwood,  he was married to Lady Alys Arryn and had nine children, one son and eight daughters.
Ser Elys Westerling was a knight of House Westerling during the reign of Aerys II Targaryen.
Elza (or Ella) was a very fine weaver slave from Meereen owned by Grazdan zo Galare.
Emberlei Frey is a member of House Frey, the third daughter of Lothar Frey and Leonella Lefford.
Emma is one of the oldest servers at the Quill and Tankard, a drinking tavern in Oldtown. She has a daughter, Rosey.
Emmon Cuy, also known as Emmon the Yellow, is a knight of House Cuy. He was named to Renly Baratheon's Rainbow Guard.
Lord Emmon Frey is the second son of Lord Walder Frey and Perra Royce. He is married to Genna Lannister. They have four sons Cleos, Lyonel, Tion and Walder.
Emmond is a boy of the Iron Islands whom Aeron Greyjoy drowns and brings back to life.
Emphyria Vance is a daughter of Lord Karyl Vance of Wayfarer's Rest.
Emrick is a Night's Watch recruit. He is the twin brother of Arron, and is from Fair Isle.
Endehar is an ironborn raider.

Ser Endrew Tarth is a member of the Night's Watch. He is the master-at-arms at Castle Black. Judging from his surname he was a member of House Tarth, but it is not known what his relation to the main branch of the house is.
Enger is a guard at Riverrun.
Eon Hunter is the Lord of Longbow Hall and is the head of House Hunter. He has three quarrelsome sons: Gilwood, Eustace and Harlan Hunter.
Erena Glover is the daughter of Robett and Sybelle Glover.
Erik Ironmaker, known as Erik the Just and Erik Anvil-Breaker, is an ironborn raider and is the elderly head of House Ironmaker.<ref>A Song of Ice and Fire Campaign Guide</ref>
Lady Ermesande Hayford is Lady of Hayford and head of House Hayford, a noble house of the Crownlands. She is still a baby
Eroeh was a girl that lived in the Lhazareen settlement that was destroyed by Khal Drogo's khalasar.
Maester Erreck is the bastard son of a hedge knight. He is considered to have considerable ability as a maester.
Erreg, known as Erreg the Kinslayer, was a legendary Andal king.
Ser Erren Florent is knight of House Florent, the son of Ser Ryam Florent and brother to Selyse and Imry. Erren is brother-in-law to Stannis Baratheon.
In A Clash of Kings, Erren is mistakenly referred to as Ser Errol.
Errok is a wildling raider. He is a thin man.
Erryk is the name of:
*Erryk (Guard), a bodyguard of Olenna Redwyne
*Erryk Cargyll, a knight of the Kingsguard
Category:Disambiguation pages
Erryk is a guardsman for Olenna Redwyne.
Esgred is the mother of Sigrin, a shipwright at Lordsport. He named the first ship that he built after her.<ref>A Clash of Kings, Chapter 24, Theon</ref>
Ethan Glover was a member of House Glover. He was the former squire to Brandon Stark.

Euron Greyjoy, known as Crow's Eye is a member of House Greyjoy and is the eldest of Lord Balon Greyjoy's younger brothers. He is captain of the Silence, a ship crewed entirely by mutes whose tongues Euron ripped out.
Euron's personal coat-of-arms is a red eye with a black pupil beneath a black iron crown supported by two crows.
Eustace is a disgraced and defrocked septon of the Faith of the Seven who used to be attached to the Sept-Beyond-the-Sea in Braavos.

Eustace was a septon attached to the Red Keep during the reign of Viserys I Targaryen. The writings of Eustace, among them The Reign of King Viserys, first of His Name, and the Dance of the Dragons That Came After, were used as a source for The Princess and The Queen, or, The Blacks and The Greens  as well as The Rogue Prince, or, A King's Brother by Archmaester Gyldayn.
Eustace Brune is Lord of the Dyre Den and head of House Brune of the Dyre Den. He is the cousin of Ser Bennard Brune, the Knight of Brownhollow.
Ser Eustace Hunter is a knight from House Hunter and is the second son of Lord Eon Hunter.
Ser Eustace Osgrey was the knight of Standfast during the reign of King Aerys I Targaryen. He had three sons and a daughter.

The Eyrie is an ancient castle and seat of House Arryn, one of the oldest lines of Andal nobility, within the Vale of Arryn. It is situated in the Mountains of the Moon astride the peak known as the Giant's Lance, several thousand feet above the valley below. Although small compared to the seats of other Great Houses in Westeros, the Eyrie is considered impregnable to attack. During winter years, the Arryns seek refuge against the cold at the base of the mountain in the Gates of the Moon.
King Eyron Stark was King in the North and Lord of Winterfell. He is buried in the crypts beneath Winterfell.
Ezzara is a Ghiscari priestess of Meereen. She is a Blue Grace.
Ezzelyno is a red priest of R'hllor in Braavos, who is oft drunk, yet cheerful.
The Faceless Men are a religious society of assassins who worship the Many-Faced God, a god of death.

Fair Isle is an island in the Sunset Sea, separated from the rest of the westerlands by the Straits of Fair Isle. The island is controlled by House Farman, whose seat Faircastle sits on it. The Crag is northeast of Fair Isle, while a peninsula containing Kayce and Feastfires is south of the island.
Falena Stokeworth was a member of House Stokeworth during the reign of Aegon III Targaryen.
Falia Flowers is the bastard daughter of Lord Humfrey Hewett. Falia is made to be a servant in Lord Hewett's castle by her trueborn sisters and her step-mother.
Lady Falyse Stokeworth is the heir of Lady Tanda Stokeworth. She has been married to Ser Balman Byrch for ten years, but they remain childless.
Farlen is the kennelmaster at Winterfell.

Feastfires is the seat of House Prester in the westerlands. It is located at the southwestern tip of a peninsula in the Sunset Sea. The peninsula is west of Lannisport and south of Fair Isle. Feastfires is southwest of nearby Kayce.<ref>A Dance with Dragons, Map of the South</ref>
Fern is a peasant who lives in Lambswold.
Ferny is a wildling. She was the wife of Craster until he died. She is an old woman.
Ferrego Antaryon is the current the Sealord of Braavos. Qarro Volentin is the current First Sword of Braavos, his protector.
Ferret was a child from King's Landing. When Ser Duncan the Tall was a child, he and Ferret were friends and they once stole a head of a spike from the walls.<ref>The Mystery Knight</ref>

The First Blackfyre Rebellion, developed out of a dynastic dispute involving the children of King Aegon IV Targaryen. The conflict was between House Targaryen and the pretenders of House Blackfyre and resulted in open civil war that divided the Seven Kingdoms over the Iron Throne.

The First Sword of Braavos is the chief protector of the Sealord of Braavos (the ruler of Braavos). Thought to be the finest swordsman in Braavos, however he is often chosen because he is the most observant of the Bravos, and most able to protect him from threats seen, and unseen.
Ser Flement Brax is a knight of House Brax. He is married to Morya Frey and they have three children.
Fogo is the khalakka, or son and heir of Khal Ogo.
Ser Forley Prester is a knight of House Prester. He is a cousin to the head of house Lord Garrison Prester.
Fornio is a ranger of the Night's Watch.
Fralegg, better known as Fralegg the Strong, is an ironborn raider and captain.
Franklyn Fowler, called the Old Hawk, is the Lord of Skyreach and head of House Fowler. He also holds the title Warden of the Prince's Pass. He is the father of the Fowler Twins.
Ser Franklyn Frey was a knight of House Frey and the brother to Lord Frey during the reign of King Aerys I Targaryen. He was considered a good tourney fighter.
The free folk are a race of people who live beyond the Wall.  They are more commonly referred to as "wildlings" everywhere south of the Wall.

There are tens, possibly hundreds of thousands of free folk split into hundreds of cultures, tribes, clans, villages and raiding parties, some reasonably cultured, others savage and hostile. The free folk refer to themselves in that way to difference themselves from the "kneelers," the people south of the Wall subject to lords and kings. The free folk view the "kneelers" as lacking freedom, whereas the people of the Seven Kingdoms to the south view the "wildlings" as lawless and primitive killers, rapists and thieves.
Frenken is the maester assigned to House Stokeworth of Stokeworth.
Frenya is a wildling spearwife.
The Frozen Shore is a stretch of coastline that sits on the Bay of Ice beyond the Wall.<ref>A Storm of Swords, Map of the North</ref>
Frynne is the daughter of a smith in Dorne. She has brown hair.<ref>A Feast for Crows, Chapter 40, The Princess in the Tower</ref>
Gage is the head cook at Winterfell.
Galazza Galare is the Ghiscari Green Grace of the Temple of the Graces in Meereen.
Galbart Glover is the head of House Glover and Master of Deepwood Motte. He is unwed. In the HBO television adaptation Game of Thrones, Galbart is portrayed by Mark Coney.

The appendices of A Clash of Kings and A Storm of Swords state that Galbart's nephew Gawen is the heir to Deepwood, while the appendices of A Feast for Crows and A Dance with Dragons state that Galbart's brother Robett is the heir.
Ser Galladon of Morne, also called the Perfect Knight, was a legendary knight from Tarth.
Archmaester Gallard is an archmaester at the Citadel in Oldtown.
Galt is a member of the Stone Crows, one of the Vale mountain  clans.
Ser Galtry the Green was a hedge knight during the reign of Aerys I. He bore nine jade mullets upon a field of leek-green as his coat-of-arms.
Galyeon of Cuy is a singer from Cuy in the Reach. He is renown for the length of his songs.
Not to be confused with Gared Tuttle, a character from another continuity.
Gared is a ranger of the Night's Watch. His are the first words of the series.
Ser Gareth Clifton is a knight of House Clifton, sworn to the Farmans of Fair Isle. He is married to Jeyne Farman, the sister of Lord Sebaston Farman.
Gareth the Grey was a knight in support of Daemon Blackfyre during the First Blackfyre Rebellion. He was considered one of the finest knights of his time.
Wisdom Garigus was a member of the Alchemists' Guild of King's Landing under the reign of Aerys II.
Gariss is a man sworn to House Stark. He is considered one of the better huntsmen of Winterfell.
Archmaester  Garizon is an archmaester at the  Citadel in Oldtown.

Ser Garlan Tyrell, known as Garlan the Gallant, is a knight of House Tyrell and the second son of Lord Mace Tyrell and Lady Alerie Hightower. His personal coat of arms is two golden roses on green, to denote his status as second son.<ref>http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Other/2/ The Citadel: Heraldry - Personal Arms</ref>
Garrett Flowers is a bastard son of Garth the Gross.
Garrett Paege is a member of House Paege. He is a squire.
Lord Garrison Prester is Lord of Feastfires and head of House Prester. His cousin is Ser Forley Prester.
Garse Flowers is a bastard son of Garth the Gross.
Ser Garse Goodbrook is  a knight of House Goodbrook. He is the husband of Kyra Frey with whom he has two children, Walder and Jeyne Goodbrook.
Ser Garth Greenfield is the Knight of Greenfield and head of House Greenfield.
Garth Greyfeather is a ranger of the Night's Watch.
Ser Garth Hightower, called Garth Greysteel, is a knight of House Hightower and the second son of Lord Leyton Hightower.
Garth Tyrell, better known as Garth the Gross, is the uncle of Lord Mace Tyrell. He serves his nephew as the Lord Seneschal of Highgarden, as he served Mace's father Lord Luthor
Garth XII Gardener was a King of the Reach and head of House Gardener.
Garth of Greenaway is a ranger of the Night's Watch. He comes from Greenaway.
Garth of Oldtown is a ranger of the Night's Watch.
Ser Gascoyne of the Greenblood is a knight and the sworn shield of Prince Trystane Martell.
Gavin, known as Gavin the Trader, is a wildling leader.

Gawen Glover is a member of House Glover, the eldest son of Robett and Sybelle Glover. The appendices of A Clash of Kings and A Storm of Swords state that Gawen is the heir to Deepwood Motte, while the appendices of A Feast for Crows and A Dance with Dragons state that his father Robett is the heir of Galbart Glover.
Lord Gawen Swann was Lord of Stonehelm and head of House Swann during the reign of Daeron II Targaryen. He was an old man by the time he participated in the Tourney at Ashford Meadow in
Gawen Westerling is Lord of the Crag and head of House Westerling.
Ser Gawen Wylde was a knight of House Wylde. He was the former master-at-arms at Storm's End.
Gelmarr, also known as Gelmarr the Grim, is an ironborn raider.
Gendel was a former King-Beyond-the-Wall, a title he shared with his brother, Gorne. He led an invasion into the North.

Gendry is a blacksmith apprentice for master Tobho Mott in King's Landing. When Gendry was old enough, an unknown lord paid his apprentice fee so he could learn to be a blacksmith; he does not know he is a bastard son of King Robert I. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Joe Dempsie.

Lady Genna Lannister is the daughter of Tytos Lannister. She was made to marry Emmon Frey and has four children with him, or so she claims they are his, no one in Casterly Rock had the courage to ever suggest otherwise, least of all her husband. Genna is the aunt of Cersei, Jaime and Tyrion and took on a maternal role to them after Joanna Lannister's death. She is also one of the few Lannisters who recognizes Tyrion's talent for political maneuvering.
Ser Gerald Gower is a knight of House Gower in service to King Stannis Baratheon.
Gerardys was a maester who served Princess Rhaenyra Targaryen on Dragonstone. He later became the Grand Maester of Queen Rhaenyra, and sat on her small council.
Gerion Lannister was a member of House Lannister.
Ser Gerold Dayne, known as Darkstar, is the head of a knightly cadet branch of House Dayne.
Gerold Grafton is the Lord of Gulltown and head of House Grafton.

Ser Gerold Hightower, known as the White Bull, was the Lord Commander of the Kingsguard during the reigns of Kings Jaehaerys II Targaryen and Aerys II Targaryen. An amalgamation of Gerold and Ser Oswell Whent is portrayed by Eddie Eyre during a flashback in Season 6 in the television adaptation Game of Thrones.<ref>https://twitter.com/EddieEyre/status/729796204733837313 Tweet by @EddieEyre: "'Gerold Hightower', but the character was an amalgamation of both really", 9 May 2016</ref>
Gerold Lannister, known as the Golden, was Lord of Casterly Rock and head of House Lannister. He was the second son of Lord Damon Lannister and Lady Cerissa Brax.
Gerren is one of the criminals Yoren picked for the Night’s Watch when he cleaned out the dungeons of King’s Landing and is part of the group marching north to the Wall.
Ser Gerris Drinkwater is a knight of House Drinkwater and long-time friend of Prince Quentyn Martell, who he accompanies on his journey to Meereen.
Gevin Harlaw is a member of House Harlaw and an ironborn raider.
Ghael is an envoy of King Cleon of Astapor. He is a former slave.
The ghost of High Heart is an old, stooped, very short woman who has visions of the future and the past. She lives at High Heart in the Riverlands.
Giants are a race of sentient humanoids that live in the extreme north of Westeros. House Umber includes a giant in their sigil.
Ser Gilbert Farring is a knight of House Farring.
Gillam is a brother of the order on the Quiet Isle. He is short, bandy-legged and has blond hair. He tends to the animals on the isle.
Gilly is a wildling girl, daughter and wife of Craster. She also has a son by Craster.
Ser Gilwood Hunter is a knight from House Hunter of Longbow Hall. He is the eldest son and heir of Lord Eon Hunter.
Ser Gladden Wylde is a knight of House Wylde.
Ser Glendon Flowers was a hedge knight during the reign of King Aerys I Targaryen. He referred to himself as Ser Glendon Ball, but was mockingly referred to as the Knight of the Pussywillows.
He claimed to be the son of Ser Quentyn Ball and used his supposed father's coat-of-arms, a fireball blazing red and yellow across a night black field, as his own.
Ser Glendon Hewett is a knight of House Hewett and a member of the Night's Watch. He is tall.
Goady is a ranger of the Night's Watch.
Lord Godric Borrell is the head of House Borrell.
Ser Godry Farring, called Godry the Giantslayer after killing a giant at the Battle of Castle Black, is a knight from House Farring and is a queen's men.
Godwyn is a guard loyal to House Lannister. He is one of the red cloaks assigned to the royal family in King's Landing.

The Golden Company is a company of sellswords founded by the Great Bastard, Aegor Rivers, known as "Bittersteel". They are considered the largest, most famous, and most expensive sellsword or mercenary company in the Free Cities. The current captain-general is Harry Strickland.
Despite the notorious unreliability of sellswords, the Golden Company is reputed to have never broken a contract. Their motto is "Our word is good as gold",

The Golden Tooth, also called the Tooth, is the seat of House Lefford in the westerlands. It is located along the river road and is east of Ashemark and Sarsfield, west of Riverrun and Pinkmaiden, and north of Hornvale.
Goldengrove is the seat of House Rowan. It is located east of Red Lake in the northern portion of the Reach.
Ser Goodwin was the master-at-arms at Evenfall Hall. He taught Brienne of Tarth how to fight.
Gormon Peake, called Gormy, was Lord of Starpike and head of House Peake during the Blackfyre Rebellions.
Gormon Tyrell is a maester serving at the Citadel. He is an uncle of Lord Mace Tyrell.
Gormond Drumm, better known as Gormond the Oldfather, is a famous former member of House Drumm. He was famous for fathering a hundred sons.
Gormond Goodbrother is the second son of Lord Gorold Goodbrother. It is very hard to tell him apart from his triplet brothers, Greydon and Gran.
Gorne was a former King-Beyond-the-Wall, a title that he shared with his brother, Gendel. He led a wildling invasion of the North with his brother.
Lord Gorold Goodbrother is Lord of Hammerhorn and head of House Goodbrother. He has twelve daughters and three sons.
Gowen Baratheon was the third son of a reigning Lord of Storm's End.
Gran Goodbrother is the third son of Lord Gorold Goodbrother. It is very hard to tell him apart from his triplet brothers, Greydon and Gormond.
Ser Grance Morrigen was a knight of House Morrigen during the reign of King Daeron II Targaryen.

Grassy Vale is a town controlled by House Meadows in the Reach. It sits along the northern shore of the Blueburn river, close to the border with the stormlands.<ref>A Dance with Dragons, Map of the South</ref> Grassfield Keep, the castle of Lord Elwood Meadows,
Grazdan is a Good Master of Astapor. He was presumably named after Grazdan the Great, who founded Old Ghis. He is tall and has a spiked beard.
Grazdan mo Eraz is one of the Wise Masters of Yunkai.

Grazdan mo Ullhor was a Good Master of Astapor. He was presumably named after Grazdan the Great, who founded Old Ghis.<ref>A Storm of Swords, Chapter 27, Daenerys</ref> He wears a tokar with a fringe of white pearls. He had grey hair.<ref>A Storm of Swords, Chapter 27, Daenerys</ref> He owned, among his many slaves, Cleon, a very talented butcher.<ref>A Storm of Swords, Chapter 71, Daenerys</ref>
Grazdan zo Galare is a former slave merchant in Meereen. He is the cousin of Galazza Galare, the Green Grace.
Grazdar zo Galare is a child of the House of Galare, one of the noble ruling families of Meereen. He is kin to Galazza Galare, the Green Grace.
The Great Walrus is a wildling leader on the Frozen Shore.
Green Gergen is a man-at arms. He was part of the Iron Throne host assembled at Eddard Stark's command and sent to stop Ser Gregor Clegane's attacks against the Riverlands.
Pello of Tyrosh, better known as Greenbeard,
The Greenblood is a river in southern Dorne and is the principal Dornish river. The river takes its name from its murky green waters which are slow-moving and shallow.
The orphans of the Greenblood live on rafts along the river.
Greenstone is the seat of House Estermont on the island of Estermont in the Stormlands.

Ser Gregor Clegane is the Knight of Clegane's Keep and is the head of House Clegane, which are landed knights and bannermen to House Lannister. Gregor is a freakishly large man and for this he is often called The Mountain That Rides or simply The Mountain. His soldiers are known as the Mountain's men.

In the television adaptation Game of Thrones, Gregor is played by Conan Stevens (season 1), Ian Whyte (season 2), and Hafþór Júlíus Björnsson for (season 4) - (season 6).<ref>http://www.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/index.html#/game-of-thrones/cast-and-crew.html/eNrjcmbOYC5kzlfPz0lxzEvMqSzJTA5ITE-1S8xN1SzLTEnNh4k65+eVpFaUsEknlpbkF+QkVtqWFJWmcjIysgEhAGCyFzg= HBO: Game of Thrones: cast and crew</ref>
Gretchel is a serving woman in service to House Arryn at the Eyrie.
The Grey Glen is the seat of House Tollett in the Vale of Arryn.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/5/ In the Vale</ref>
The Grey King is a legendary monarch of the Iron Islands who is said to have ruled for 1,007 years.

Grey Worm is an Unsullied purchased by and sworn to Daenerys Targaryen. He is the commander of Daenerys's Unsullied and one of her trusted advisors. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Jacob Anderson.
Greydon Goodbrother is the heir to House Goodbrother. It is very hard to tell him apart from his triplet brothers, Gran and Gormond.
Greyshield is one of the Shield Islands in the Reach. The westernmost of the isles, it lies near the mouth of the river Mander. It is the site of Grimston, the seat of House Grimm.

Greywater Watch, also known as Greywater, is the seat of House Reed in the North. It is roughly located in an eastern headwater of the Green Fork
The Griffin King is a legendary figure who lived thousands of years ago. He was the leader of the First Men of the Vale and the last of the Mountain Kings. His connection to griffins is unknown.

Griffin's Roost is the seat of House Connington in the Stormlands. It is a castle located between Storm's End and Crow's Nest in northwestern Cape Wrath. It is ruled by Red Ronnet Connington, the Knight of Griffin's Roost.
Grigg, better known as Grigg the Goat, is a wildling raider.
Grisel is a thin old woman and a member of House Baelish's household staff.
Grisella was a female wildling skinchanger who could inhabit the body of a goat.
Groleo is the captain of the cog Saduleon, renamed the Balerion.
Grubbs is a ranger of the Night's Watch.
Grunt  is a man-at-arms sworn to House Bolton. He  is one of the Bastard's Boys.
Gueren is a member of the Night's Watch. He is a recruiter or wandering crow who scours the Seven Kingdoms in search of new recruits for the Watch.
Maester Gulian is a maester of the Citadel.
Ser Gulian Qorgyle is a knight of House Qorgyle. He is the eldest child and heir of Lord Quentyn Qorgyle, Lord of Sandstone. He has a younger brother, Ser Arron.
Gulian Swann is Lord of Stonehelm and head of House Swann. He is well past forty.
Guncer Sunglass is Lord of Sweetport Sound and head of House Sunglass. He is pious in his faith in the Seven,
Ser Gunthor Hightower is a knight of House Hightower. The third son of Lord Leyton Hightower, he is married to Jeyne Fossoway.
Gurn is the father of Gunthor son of Gurn, a member of the Stone Crows in the Mountains of the Moon. It is unknown if Gurn is still alive.
Lord Guthor Grimm is the Lord of Greyshield in the Shield Islands.
Ser Guyard Morrigen, also known as Guyard the Green, is a knight of House Morrigen of the Stormlands. He was named to King Renly's Rainbow Guard.
Archmaester  Guyne is an archmaester at the  Citadel in Oldtown.
Ser Gwayne Corbray was a knight of House Corbray and member of the Kingsguard during the reign of Daeron II Targaryen. He wielded the Valyrian steel sword Lady Forlorn.
Ser Gwayne Gaunt was a knight of House Gaunt and member of Aerys II Targaryen's Kingsguard.
Ser Gwayne Hightower was a knight from House Hightower. He was the youngest son of Ser Otto Hightower and the younger brother of Alicent Hightower, who was married to King Viserys I Targaryen.
Gwin Goodbrother is the daughter of Lord Gorold Goodbrother.
Lady Gwynesse Harlaw is the elder sister of Lord Rodrik Harlaw. She is seven years older than Lord Rodrik. Her husband died during the Battle of Fair Isle during the Greyjoy Rebellion.
Lord Gylbert Farwynd is Lord of the Lonely Light and head of House Farwynd of the Lonely Light.
Archmaester Gyldayn was an archmaester of the Citadel.  He was also the last maester to serve at Summerhall before it burned down.

Gyldayn also wrote a long but incomplete history of House Targaryen. He sent his papers to Archmaester Gerold at the Citadel, likely for for his commentary and approval, where they remained until they were recently discovered by Maester Yandel. Yandel has used Gyldayn's work as a major source for his book The World of Ice and Fire, including a complete history of Aegon's Conquest.

Yandel has discovered other manuscripts by Gyldayn, but many pages have been misplaced or destroyed, and still others have been damaged by neglect and by fire. Still, Yandel believes that more pages will be found one day, and Gyldayn's lost masterwork will be published, as the maesters of the Citadel are greatly excited by what has been discovered so far.
Gyleno  Dothare is a patron of the Happy Port. He has a brother, Gyloro Dothare.
Ser Gyles, better known as Gyles Greycloak, was a former member of the Kingsguard.
Gyles Farwynd is the son of Lord Gylbert Farwynd. He resembles his father.
Gyles Grafton is a member of House Grafton and is the youngest son of Lord Gerold Grafton.
Gyles III Gardener was a King of the Reach and head of House Gardener. During his rule Highgarden reached the apex of its power.
Lord Gyles Rosby is Lord of Rosby and head of House Rosby. He is sickly and coughs constantly.
Gyloro Dothare is a patron of the Happy Port. He has a brother, Gyleno Dothare.
Gynir, also known as Gynir Rednose and simply Rednose, is an ironborn raider.
Gysella Goodbrother is the daughter of Lord Gorold Goodbrother.
Haggo is a bloodrider to Khal Drogo. He is a large man.

Haggon was a free folk skinchanger. He was known as a friend of the Night's Watch, trading with them and bringing news of life beyond the Wall. He was a mentor of Varamyr Sixskins. He was tall, grim, had hard hands and a rough voice.
Hairy Hal is a ranger of the Night's Watch.
Hake is a steward of the Night's Watch. He is a cook
Halder is a builder of the Night's Watch with a nickname of Stoney. He is sixteen years old when he joins the Watch in
Haldon, called Haldon Halfmaester, is a healer and the tutor for Young Griff.
Hali is a wildling spearwife.
Hallis Mollen, usually called Hal, is a guard at Winterfell.
Hallyne, also known as Hallyne the Pyromancer, is the head of the Alchemists' Guild. He is a third generation alchemist. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Roy Dotrice.
Ser Halmon Paege is a knight and current head of House Paege.

Halys Hornwood<ref>In A Clash of Kings-Chapter 16, he is mentioned first as Harys and later as Halys.</ref> is Lord of the Hornwood and head of House Hornwood. He is the husband of Lady Donella Manderly and the father of a trueborn heir, Daryn, and a natural son, Larence Snow.
Hamish the Harper is a singer.
The Hand of the King is the chief advisor to the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and is the executor of the king's command in the Seven Kingdoms.
The Happy Port is a brothel in Braavos that sits across from the Mummer's Ship. It is run by Meralyn.<ref>A Feast for Crows, Chapter 34, Cat of the Canals</ref>

Ser Harbert  was a castellan of Storm's End. Already old in  His family name is not stated so it is not clear if Harbert was a Baratheon himself. Since Ser Cortnay Penrose was castellan when Renly was made master of laws, it is clear that Harbert was dead before Renly achieved manhood.
Ser Harbert Paege was a knight of House Paege during the reign of Aerys I.
Hareth, nicknamed Horse by the brothers of the Night's Watch, is a stablehand in Mole's Town.
Harghaz is an animal handler in the fighting pits of Meereen.
Ser Harlan Grandison was a knight from House Grandison. A member of the Kingsguard during the reign of Aerys II Targaryen.
Ser Harlan Hunter is a knight from House Hunter and is the youngest son of Lord Eon Hunter.
Harle the Handsome is a wildling leader. According to Tormund Giantsbane, he and his brother Harle the Huntsman, who both had a son with the same woman, hate each other.
Harle the Huntsman is a wildling leader. According to Tormund Giantsbane, he and his brother Harle the Handsome, who both had a son with the same woman, hate each other.
Harlen Tyrell, was a member of House Tyrell and High Steward of Highgarden. He was the first to rule the Reach as Lord of Highgarden after the War of Conquest.
Harlon Botley is the fourth son of Lord Sawane Botley.
Harlon Greyjoy was the first son of Lord Quellon Greyjoy. His mother was a member of House Stonetree. He died from greyscale as a child.
Harma, known as Harma the Dogshead, is a captain in Mance Rayder's army, commanding the vanguard. She has a brother, Halleck.

Lord Harmen Uller is the Lord of Hellholt and head of House Uller. He is the father of Ellaria Sand, the paramour of Prince Oberyn Martell. This makes him the grandfather of the four youngest Sand Snakes: Elia, Obella, Dorea and Loreza. He has also a younger brother, Ser Ulwyck Uller.
Harmond Umber, known as the Drunken Giant, was a Lord of the Last Hearth and head of House Umber.
Harmund Sharp is a member of House Sharp. He has many sons.
Harmune is the maester in service to the Night's Watch at Eastwatch-by-the-Sea. He writes and reads all the correspondence for Cotter Pyke, the commander of Eastwatch.
Harodon is an archmaester at the  Citadel in Oldtown.
Goodwife Harra is a servant in service to House Whent. She was an old woman. She was executed by Lord Roose Bolton at Harrenhal.
Harrag Hoare was a former King of the Iron Islands. He was chosen by a kingsmoot.
Harrag Sharp, better known as Harrag Sheepstealer, is an ironborn raider from House Sharp.

Ser Harras Harlaw, known as the Knight of Grey Garden, is the head of House Harlaw of Grey Garden and is the master of Grey Garden. A knight, he is the heir of House Harlaw of Ten Towers; its current lord, Rodrik Harlaw, has no surviving children.
Harren Botley is the eldest son of Lord Sawane Botley and is the heir of House Botley.
Harren Half-Hoare is an ironborn raider.<ref>Harren may be related to House Hoare.</ref>

Harren Hoare, known as Harren the Black or Black Harren, was last of the Kings of the Isles and the Rivers to rule over the Iron Islands and the riverlands, and the last member of House Hoare to rule. He completed the grand castle, Harrenhal, which would serve to be his doom.

Harrenhal, the largest castle in the Seven Kingdoms, is the seat of House Whent in the riverlands, on the north shore of the Gods Eye lake. Since its burning by dragonfire in the War of Conquest, however, it has become a dark and ruinous place.
The castle's holdings are some of the richest in Westeros, claiming vast tracts of green fertile land
Harrion Karstark, also called Harry, is the eldest son and heir of Lord Rickard Karstark.
Harrold Hardyng, often called Harry the Heir and sometimes the Young Falcon, is a gallant, handsome squire, and a ward of Lady Anya Waynwood.
Ser Harrold Osgrey was the second son of Ser Eustace Osgrey. He was slain at the Battle of the Redgrass Field, during the Blackfyre Rebellion. He is buried at Standfast.
Ser Harrold Westerling was a knight of House Westerling and Lord Commander of the Kingsguard. He served under King Viserys I Targaryen and was replaced by Ser Criston Cole.
Ser Harry Sawyer is a knight of House Sawyer.
Harry Strickland, also known as Homeless Harry Strickland, is the captain-general in command of the Golden Company.
Harsley was an inhabitant of the Riverlands. He was slain by the forces of House Lannister during the War of the Five Kings.
Harwin is a member of the household guard of Lord Eddard Stark at Winterfell.

Ser Harwin Strong, known as Breakbones, was a knight from House Strong and heir to Harrenhal. He also served as a captain in the City Watch of King's Landing. The rumored lover of Princess Rhaenyra Targaryen, Harwin is believed by some to have been the real father of her first three children, (Jacaerys, Lucerys, and Joffrey Velaryon).
Harwood Fell is Lord of Felwood and head of House Fell.

Harwood Stout is the Lord of Goldgrass and head of House Stout.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses//2/#In the North</ref> He is a vassal of Lady Barbrey Dustin of Barrowton.

Harwyn Hoare, known as Harwyn Hardhand, was a King of the Iron Islands from House Hoare who conquered the riverlands and became the first King of the Isles and the Rivers. The ironborn longship Hardhand is presumably named in his honor.
Ser Harwyn Plumm, called Hardstone, is the third son of Lord Philip Plumm.
Ser Harys Haigh is a knight of House Haigh. He is son of Ser Leslyn Haigh and Perriane Frey.
Ser Harys Swyft is the knight of Cornfield and head of House Swyft. He is the good-father to Ser Kevan Lannister.

Hayford is the seat of House Hayford in the Crownlands. According to semi-canon sources, Hayford is located half a day's ride north of King's Landing along the kingsroad.<ref>A Song of Ice and Fire Campaign Guide</ref> Hayford sits upon a hilltop and has a stream running alongside the castle.
Hayhead is a guard sworn to House Stark.  He has a large wen on his nose.
Hazrak zo Loraq is a famous Ghiscari citizen of the city of Meereen. He is an ancestor of Hizdahr zo Loraq.
Hazzea is a Ghiscari child of the plains near the city of Meereen. She is a farmer's daughter and was four years old at the time of her death.
A hedge knight is a wandering knight without a master, many are quite poor. Hedge knights travel the length and breadth of Westeros looking for gainful employment.

Queen Helaena Targaryen was the sister-wife to Aegon II, daughter of King Viserys I Targaryen and his second wife, Queen Alicent Hightower. She had three children with her husband, the twins Jaehaerys and Jaehaera and Maelor. Helaena was a dragonrider, her dragon was Dreamfyre.
Lady Helicent Uffering was a member of House Uffering and was the sister to Ser Rolland Uffering.
Hellholt, also called the Hellholt, is a castle and the seat of House Uller in southern Dorne. It is located near the source of the river Brimstone, east of Sandstone and west of Vaith.
Helliweg is a maester of the Citadel in service at Runestone to House Royce.
Helly is a serving girl at the Peach, an inn and brothel in Stoney Sept.
Helman Tallhart is a knight, the head of House Tallhart and the Master of Torrhen's Square.
Helya is the steward of Pyke. She is a bentback old woman.
Hendry Bracken is a member of House Bracken and nephew to Lord Jonos Bracken.
Henk, better known as Henk the Helm, is a wildling raider. He comes from a place by the sea.
Henly was the stableman in the town of Ashford.
Ser Herbert Bolling is a knight of House Bolling.
Heward is a guard sworn to House Stark.
Hibald is a merchant.

The High Sparrow is the current High Septon of the Faith of the Seven. His real name is unknown as High Septons abandon their names once elected to office. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Jonathan Pryce.

Highgarden is a castle which serves as the seat of House Tyrell, regional capital of the Reach and the heart of chivalry in the Seven Kingdoms. It lies on the Mander and is where the Ocean Road meets the Roseroad, making it an important crossroads.<ref>A Dance with Dragons, Map of the South</ref>

Mace Tyrell is the Lord of Highgarden. The castle's household includes Lord Seneschal Garth Tyrell, Maester Lomys, the captain of the guard Igon Vyrwel, the master-at-arms Ser Vortimer Crane, and the fool Butterbumps.
Hilmar Drumm, known as Hilmar the Cunning, was a member of House Drumm. He took the Valyrian steel sword Red Rain from an armored knight with nothing but his wits and a wooden cudgel.

Hizdahr zo Loraq, Fourteenth of That Noble Name, is a Ghiscari noble of the city of Meereen. He is extremely wealthy and can trace his descent from several notable Ghiscari citizens such as Mazdhan the Magnificent, Hazrak the Handsome and Zharaq the Liberator. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Joel Fry.
Hoarfrost Umber was a Lord of the Last Hearth, the grandfather of Greatjon Umber and father of Hother Umber and Mors Umber.
Hobb, better known as Three-Finger Hobb, is the main cook at Castle Black for the Night's Watch.
Ser Hobber Redwyne, mocked as Slobber, is a knight of House Redwyne. He is a son of Lord Paxter Redwyne and Mina Tyrell and has a twin brother, Ser Horas Redwyne.
Hod is a traveler at an inn in the Crownlands.
Hodor is a stableboy serving at Winterfell. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Kristian Nairn as well as by Sam Coleman in a Season 6 flashback.
Hoke, known as Hoke the Horseleg, is a guard in service with House Lannister.
Holger is the father of Dolf, who is the father of Shagga. Holger is a member of the Stone Crows. It is unknown if Holger is still alive.
Holly is a wildling spearwife.
Hop-Robin is a Night's Watch recruit. He has a clubfoot.
Ser Horas Redwyne, mocked as Horror, is the son of Lord Paxter Redwyne and a twin to his brother, Ser Hobber Redwyne.
Horn Hill is the seat of House Tarly in the Reach. Located on an eponymous hill, the castle lies south of Highgarden and a hundred leagues northeast of Oldtown among the thickly-wooded foothills

There is a pond that lies below the castle. Given the Tarly huntsman sigil and Lord Randyll Tarly's threats to kill Samwell Tarly while hunting, it may be surmised that the woods around Horn Hill are teeming with game.
The Horn of Herrock is a black, twisted horn that is banded with gold. It is named after Herrock Kenning, the founder of House Kenning of Kayce.
Hornwood is a castle in the north and the seat of House Hornwood.

<!--George R. R. Martin has not published the location of Hornwood on maps yet, but the non-canon map for HBO's Game of Thrones places the castle between the Dreadfort and White Harbor, just north of the Sheepshead Hills.<ref>http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/ Game of Thrones Viewer's Guide</ref>-->
Horton Redfort is Lord of Redfort and head of House Redfort. He has been married three times. He has four sons: Ser Jasper, Ser Creighton, Ser Jon and Ser Mychel.
Ser Hosman Norcross is a knight of House Norcross. He is married to Delena Florent. They have two children; Alester and Renly Norcross.

Ser Hosteen Frey is a knight of House Frey, the sixth son of Lord Walder Frey, the first one born of his third wife, Amarei Crakehall. He is married to Bellena Hawick. Hosteen is a seasoned soldier and the fiercest fighter of Walder's brood.
Hoster Frey is the eldest child of Ser Whalen Frey. He is a squire to Ser Damon Paege.
Hoster Tully is the Lord of Riverrun and head of House Tully. With Minisa Whent he fathered Catelyn, Lysa, and Ser Edmure. He is also the brother of the Blackfish, Ser Brynden Tully.

Hot Pie is an orphan baker's boy of King's Landing, collected by Yoren and bound for the Wall with Arya Stark. In the TV series, he is played by Ben Hawkey.<ref>http://www.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/index.html#/game-of-thrones/cast-and-crew.html/eNrjcmbOYC5kzlfPz0lxzEvMqSzJTA5ITE-1S8xN1SzLTEnNh4k65+eVpFaUsEknlpbkF+QkVtqWFJWmcjIysgEhAGCyFzg= HBO: Game of Thrones: cast and crew</ref>
Hother Umber, better known as Hother Whoresbane, is a member of House Umber and is the uncle of Lord Greatjon Umber. Hother is the joint castellan of Last Hearth with his older brother, Mors.
Hotho Harlaw, known as Hotho Humpback, is a member of House Harlaw and the master of the Tower of Glimmering.

House Baratheon of Storm's End is one of the Great Houses of Westeros, and is the principal house in the stormlands, which they rule as Lords Paramount of the Stormlands. Their seat, Storm's End, is an ancient castle raised by the Storm Kings from the now-extinct House Durrandon. The Baratheon sigil is a crowned black stag on a field of gold. Members of the family tend to be tall and powerfully built, with black hair and blue eyes, as well as strong, square jawlines. They are known for their mercurial tempers, and their words are "Ours is the Fury".

After Robert's Rebellion, House Baratheon split into three branches: Lord Robert Baratheon was crowned King and took residence at King's Landing, thereby creating House Baratheon of King's Landing. Robert gave the seat of Dragonstone to his younger brother, Stannis, creating House Baratheon of Dragonstone. Robert's youngest brother, Renly, became the Lord of Storm's End, continuing House Baratheon of Storm's End.
House Farman of Faircastle is the noble house ruling from Faircastle on Fair Isle, off the coast of the westerlands. They are known for their hatred of the ironborn from the Iron Islands.

Neither their arms or their words appear in the books, but according to semi-canon sources they blazon their arms with three silver ships on blue, a border of crimson and gold.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/6/ Houses in the Westerlands</ref>
House Fell of Felwood  is a noble house sworn to Storm's End. Their seat is Felwood in the northern Stormlands.

Neither their arms or their words appear in the books, but according to semi-canon sources their arms are blazoned per fess, a white crescent moon in the first on black above a green field, a sprucetree line between.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/8/ Houses in the Stormlands</ref>
House Fossoway of Cider Hall is a noble house from the Reach, one of the principal bannermen sworn to House Tyrell of Highgarden. Cider Hall is located at the fork of the Mander and the Cockleswent.
They are commonly referred as the red-apple Fossoways, to differentiate them from the other branch of the house, the green apple Fossoways from New Barrel, that split from the red apples in .

Their banner is a red apple over a golden field.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/7/ Houses in the Reach</ref> Their motto does not appear in the books, but according to semi-canon sources it is "A Taste of Glory".<ref>The Citadel. http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Mottoes/ House Mottoes</ref>
House Fossoway of New Barrel is a knightly house from the Reach, sworn to House Tyrell of Highgarden.

They are commonly referred as the green-apple Fossoways, to differentiate them from the original branch of the house, the red apple Fossoways from Cider Hall. The exact location of New Barrel is unknown but it's in the Reach.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/7/ Houses in the Reach</ref>
Their banner is a green apple over a golden field.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/7/ Houses in the Reach</ref> Their motto does not appear in the books.

House Frey of the Crossing is a noble house of the riverlands. Their main seat is the Twins, a pair of castles on each bank of the northern Green Fork of the Trident that serves as a vital bridge across the river. The lord of the house is called the Lord of the Crossing.

The strategic location of the Twins has allowed the house to become quite wealthy. Under their current lord, Walder Frey, they have grown greatly in both size and power. One of the most powerful bannermen of the Tullys, the Freys can field a thousand knights and three thousand foot.

Their sigil is two blue towers united by a bridge on silver-grey, representing the Twins. Their house words are not mentioned in the books. Most current Freys tend to share the weaselly appearance of their common ancestor, Lord Walder.

House Harlaw of Harlaw is one of the most powerful houses from the Iron Islands, ruling over the entire island of Harlaw from the castle of Ten Towers. Their blazon is a silver scythe on black.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/3/ Houses in the Iron Islands</ref> Their motto has not appeared in the books.

All the other houses of Harlaw pledge fealty to them, including Houses Volmark, Stonetree, Myre and Kenning. Cadet branches of the Harlaws are located at Grey Garden, Harlaw Hall, Harridan Hill, and the Tower of Glimmering.

House Karstark of Karhold is a noble house from Karhold in the north. They are a cadet branch of their overlords, the Starks of Winterfell, and are among their principal bannermen. and their motto is "The Sun of Winter".<ref>The Citadel. http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Entry/House_Karstark House Karstark</ref>

House Lannister of Casterly Rock is one of the Great Houses of Seven Kingdoms, and the principal house of the westerlands. Their seat is Casterly Rock, though another branch exists that is based in nearby Lannisport. Their sigil is a golden lion on a field of crimson. The Warden of the West is a Lannister by tradition.

Fair-haired, tall, and handsome, the Lannisters are the blood of Andal adventurers who carved out a mighty kingdom in the western hills and valleys. Through the female line they boast of descent from Lann the Clever, the legendary trickster of the Age of Heroes who tricked the members of House Casterly into giving him Casterly Rock

The Lannisters reigned as Kings of the Rock until they fell to the Targaryen conquest, but were allowed to remain the liege lords of the westerlands. The House had fallen on hard times during the rule of Lord Tytos, but was restored to its former glory by Lord Tywin. His daughter Cersei is the queen of King Robert I Baratheon, while her twin Ser Jaime is a knight of Robert's Kingsguard. Members of the family tend to have golden hair and emerald green eyes.

House Lychester is a noble house from Castle Lychester in the riverlands. According to semi-canon sources they blazon their arms with orange and white gyronny, a black talon.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/4/ Houses in the Riverlands</ref>

House Nymeros Martell of Sunspear is one of the Great Houses of Westeros and is the ruling house of Dorne. 'Nymeros' indicates "of the line of Nymeria," but generally it is simply called House Martell. The seat of the Prince of Dorne is Sunspear in southeastern Dorne.

The Martells of old used a spear as their emblem, while Nymeria and her Rhoynar used the sun as theirs. When Nymeria wed Lord Mors Martell, the symbols were combined into a gold spear piercing a red sun on an orange field. Their words are Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken. In appearance they are what Daeron I Targaryen considered salty Dornishmen, with dark eyes, dark hair in ringlets, and olive skin.
House Osgrey of Standfast is a noble house from Standfast in the Reach. Sworn to House Rowan, its lands border those of House Webber and House Stackhouse.

Their blazon is a chequy lion, green and gold rampant on a field of white.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/7/ Houses in the Reach</ref> Their motto has not appeared yet.

House Payne is a noble house from the Westerlands. It is one of the principal houses sworn to House Lannister.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/6/ Houses in the Westerlands</ref>

House Stark of Winterfell is one of the Great Houses of Westeros and the principal noble house of the north; many lesser houses are sworn to them. In days of old they ruled as Kings of Winter, but since the Wars of Conquest by House Targaryen they have been Wardens of the North. Their seat, Winterfell, is an ancient castle renowned for its strength.

Their sigil is a grey direwolf racing across a field of white, and their words are "Winter is Coming", one of only a few house mottoes to be a warning rather than a boast. Members of the family tend to be lean of build and long of face, with dark brown hair and grey eyes. Several of the POV characters of A Song of Ice and Fire are members of House Stark.

Aside from the Karstarks of Karhold, the Starks of Winterfell may have distant relatives elsewhere in the north, possibly in White Harbor and Barrowton.<ref>So Spake Martin: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/SSM/Entry/1239/ The Stark Family (June 10, 2003)</ref> Some younger Starks have also held vassal holdfasts for the lords of Winterfell.<ref>So Spake Martin: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/SSM/Entry/Land_Ownership_and_Marriage_in_Westeros Land Ownership and Marriage in Westeros? (December 19, 1999)</ref>
House Stokeworth of Stokeworth is a noble house from the Crownlands. Sworn to King's Landing, they live at nearby Castle Stokeworth north of the capital.
They blazon their arms with a white lamb holding a golden goblet on a green field.<ref>The Citadel. http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Mottoes/ House Mottoes</ref>

House Targaryen is a noble family of Valyrian descent that escaped the Doom. They lived for centuries on the island of Dragonstone until Aegon the Conqueror and his sisters rode their dragons in their conquest of the Seven Kingdoms.

House Targaryen ruled as the kings on the Iron Throne and as the Great House of the crownlands for nearly 300 years, until their ouster in Robert's Rebellion, which they call the War of the Usurper.  Their seats were the Red Keep in the capital city of King's Landing, the castle of Dragonstone, and the summer residence of Summerhall.

House Tarly of Horn Hill is a noble house of the Reach, one of the strongest sworn to House Tyrell.<ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/7/ Houses in the Reach</ref> Their motto is not revealed in the books, but according to semi-canon sources it is "First in Battle".<ref>The Citadel. http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Mottoes/House Mottoes</ref>
Marcher lords of the Dornish Marches,

House Templeton is a noble house from Ninestars in the Vale of Arryn. They are one of the great knightly houses sworn to House Arryn. The head of the House is given the title of 'Knight of Ninestars'. Its current head is Ser Symond Templeton.

Although they are a knightly house, they are very powerful, and their strength and influence are comparable to many lords. It is said they can easily raise a thousand men. The current generation House Templeton may be related to the Starks of Winterfell through the female line.

They blazon their arms with nine stars, one of 7 points and eight of 6 points, upon a gold saltire on black. <ref>The Citadel. Heraldry: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/Heraldry/Houses/5/ Houses in the Vale</ref> Their motto does not appear in the books.

House Tully of Riverrun is one of the Great Houses of the Seven Kingdoms. Lord Hoster Tully, the Lord Paramount of the Trident, rules over the riverlands from the Tully seat of Riverrun. Their sigil is a silver trout leaping on a blue and red striped field, and their words are "Family, Duty, Honor."

Howland Reed is the head of House Reed and the Lord of Greywater Watch. He holds dominion over the crannogmen of the Neck. Howland’s children are Meera and Jojen. He is one of Eddard Stark's closest friends and fought alongside him in many conflicts during Robert's Rebellion.  In the television adaptation Game of Thrones, Howland is played by Leo Woodruff during flashbacks in Season 6.
Hubard Rambton is a knight of House Rambton sworn to Stannis Baratheon. He has three sons.
Ser Hugh of the Vale was a squire to Lord Jon Arryn and became a knight upon his death. His arms are a crescent moon on blue.
Ser Hugh Beesbury is a member of House Beesbury.
Hugh Hammer, or Hard Hugh, was a blacksmith's bastard on Dragonstone during the time of the Dance of the Dragons. He was one of the dragonseeds.
Ser Hugo Vance is a member of House Vance of Atranta. He has four brothers; Ser Ronald, Ser Ellery, Kirth and Maester Jon.
Hugo Wull, called Big Bucket and the Wull, is the clan chief of House Wull in the North. He has the biggest belly in the northern mountains and the most men.
Hugor of the Hill was the first King of the Andals in Andalos.
Hullen is a member of the Stark household. He is the master of horse at Winterfell.  He is the father of Harwin.
Ser Humfrey Beesbury was a knight of House Beesbury during the reign of King Daeron II Targaryen. Ser Humfrey Hardyng was his brother-in-law.
Ser Humfrey Clifton is a knight of House Clifton. He is sworn to King Stannis I.
Ser Humfrey Hardyng was a tourney knight of renown during the reign of King Daeron II Targaryen. His brother by marriage was Ser Humfrey Beesbury.
Humfrey Hewett is the head of House Hewett and is the Lord of Oakenshield, one of the Shield Islands in the Reach.
Ser Humfrey Swyft is a knight of House Swyft.
Ser Humfrey Wagstaff was the castellan of Grandview for House Grandison. When already a man of sixty-five, he was betrothed to a sixteen-year-old Brienne of Tarth.
Hunnimore was a maester who served at Dragonstone during the Dance of the Dragons.
Husband is the husband of Sharna, the innkeep of the Inn of the Kneeling Man.
Ser Hyle Hunt is a knight of House Hunt in service to House Tarly.

Ibben (sometimes called Ib after its largest island) is an island nation in the Shivering Sea, which is the polar sea north of the eastern continent, Essos. The chief city of Ibben is the Port of Ibben, situated on the southern coast of its largest island, Ib.
Iggo is a Dothraki member of the Brave Companions. He is scarred.
Igon Vyrwel is a member of House Vyrwel who serves as the captain of the guards for House Tyrell at Highgarden.
Ser Illifer, better known as Ser Illifer the Penniless, is a hedge knight. His coat-of-arms is gold and ermine gyronny. His traveling partner is Ser Creighton Longbough.

Illyrio Mopatis is a wealthy and powerful Magister in the Free City of Pentos. He is a dealer in spices, gemstones, dragonbone, and other things. He is morbidly obese, with yellow hair and a forked beard. For a time he served as custodian of the exiled Targaryens and now seeks to return them to the Iron Throne. In the TV series he is played by Roger Allam.
Ser Ilyn Payne is a knight from House Payne. He serves as the King's Justice, the royal executioner, for King Robert I Baratheon.

Ser Imry Florent is a knight of House Florent. He is the son of Ser Ryam Florent and brother to Selyse and Erren. Imry is brother-in-law to Stannis Baratheon. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Gordon Mahon.<ref>IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3034964/ Gordon Mahon</ref>
The Inn of the Kneeling Man is an inn in the riverlands located near the spot where Torrhen Stark, King in the North, is said to have bent the knee to Aegon the Conqueror.

The main building sits along the shore where the Red Fork of the Trident bends. It has long, low wings that stretch out. The lower story is made of grey stone, the upper one of whitewashed wood. Its roof is slate and has a stables and an arbor. It reportedly brews a good ale.

The Iron Fleet is the largest grouping of longships from the Iron Islands. They number one hundred, and unlike other ironborn ships they belong to the Seastone Chair. It is one of the three most powerful fleets of Westeros, along with the royal fleet of the crownlands and the Redwyne fleet of the Arbor.<ref>So Spake Martin: http://www.westeros.org/Citadel/SSM/Entry/The_Lannister_Fleet The Lannister Fleet, September 26, 1999</ref>

Each ship of the Iron Fleet is captained and crewed by people of various islands. The ships, while smaller than the war dromonds of the mainland, are three times the size of a standard longship of the Isles. The fleet's commander, the Lord Captain of the Iron Fleet, is Victarion Greyjoy.
The Iron Islands is one of the constituent regions of the Seven Kingdoms. Until the War of Conquest it was ruled by the Kings of the Iron Islands and then the Kings of the Isles and the Rivers.

The Iron Islands are home to a fierce seafaring people who call themselves the ironborn. While some say the archipelago is named after the abundant iron ore on the islands, the ironmen claim it is instead named after their own unyielding nature.

The isles are ruled by House Greyjoy from their castle of Pyke. Notable houses have included Blacktyde, Botley, Drumm, Goodbrother, Greyiron, Harlaw, Hoare, Merlyn, Stonehouse, Sunderly, Tawney, and Wynch. Noble bastards from the Iron Islands receive the surname Pyke.
Ironbelly is a master smith in King's Landing.

Irri is a Dothraki handmaiden to Daenerys Targaryen. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones she is played by Amrita Acharia.<ref>http://www.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/index.html#/game-of-thrones/cast-and-crew.html/eNrjcmbOYC5kzlfPz0lxzEvMqSzJTA5ITE-1S8xN1SzLTEnNh4k65+eVpFaUsEknlpbkF+QkVtqWFJWmcjIysgEhAGCyFzg= HBO: Game of Thrones: cast and crew</ref>
Ser Jacelyn Bywater, called Ironhand, is a knight of House Bywater. A serving officer of the City Watch of King's Landing and captain of the Mud Gate.
Jack-Be-Lucky is a member of the Brotherhood without Banners.
Jacks is a guard sworn to House Stark.

Princess Jaehaera Targaryen was the daughter of Aegon II Targaryen and his sister-wife and Queen Helaena Targaryen, and the first wife and queen of her cousin Aegon III Targaryen. Jaehaera had a twin brother, Jaehaerys Targaryen, and a younger brother, Maelor Targaryen. The dragon Morghul was bound to Jaehaera.

Jaehaerys I Targaryen , known as the Conciliator, the Wise or the Old King, was the fourth Targaryen king to sit the Iron Throne, ruling from . He was a dragonrider whose mount was Vermithor. He was the grandson of Aegon the Conqueror.

Jaehaerys II Targaryen was king of the Seven Kingdoms and the sixteenth Targaryen to sit the Iron Throne. He was the second born son of King Aegon V Targaryen and Queen Betha Blackwood. Jaehaerys was the father of Aerys II Targaryen and the grandfather of Prince Rhaegar, Prince Viserys and Queen Daenerys.

Prince Jaehaerys Targaryen was the son of Aegon II Targaryen and his sister-wife Queen Helaena Targaryen.  He was King Aegon's firstborn son and heir, next in line to the Iron Throne. He had a twin sister, Princess Jaehaera Targaryen, and a younger brother Prince Maelor Targaryen. The dragon Shrykos was bound to Jaehaerys.
Jafer Flowers is a ranger of the Night's Watch. He is a bastard from the Reach, judging by his surname.
Jaggot is a member of the Stone Crows, one of the Vale mountain clans found in the Mountains of the Moon.
Jaime Frey is the third son of Ser Raymund Frey and Beony Beesbury, the twin of Tywin. He is a newborn babe.

Ser Jaime Lannister, also known as the Kingslayer, is a knight from House Lannister. He is the second child and first-born son of Lord Tywin Lannister of Casterly Rock and his wife, Lady Joanna, also of House Lannister. He is the twin brother of Queen Cersei Lannister.

Raised at the age of fifteen to the Kingsguard of the Mad King, Aerys II Targaryen, Jaime became the youngest member in the history of the prestigious knightly order. In A Storm of Swords, Jaime becomes a POV character. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is played by Nikolaj Coster-Waldau.<ref>HBO: Game of Thrones:http://www.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/index.html#/game-of-thrones/cast-and-crew/index.html Cast and Crew.</ref>
Jalabhar Xho, Prince of the Red Flower Vale, is an exile prince from the Summer Isles residing in the Red Keep.

Ser Jammos Frey is a knight of House Frey and the thirteenth son of Lord Walder Frey, the second by his fourth wife, Lady Alyssa Blackwood. Jammos is married to Sallei Paege and has three children: Big Walder, Dickon, and Mathis Frey.
Janei Lannister is the daughter of Kevan Lannister and Dorna Swyft. She is their youngest child. Janei does not appear in the books in person.
Lady Janna Tyrell is the sister of Lord Mace Tyrell. She is is buxom

Janos Slynt is the head of House Slynt and commander of the City Watch of King's Landing. His father was a butcher. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones, he is played by Dominic Carter.<ref>http://www.liftingfaces.com/2009/09/game-of-thrones-cast-so-far/ Game of Thrones: cast so far on Liftingfaces</ref>
Jaqen H'ghar is the name of a sly Lorathi criminal who meets Arya Stark on her way to the Wall. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Tom Wlaschiha.

Ser Jared Frey is a knight of House Frey. He is the fourth son of Lord Walder Frey, the first son born from his second wife, Cyrenna Swann. He is married to his cousin Alys Frey and has two children; Ser Tytos and Kyra Frey.
Ser Jaremy Rykker is a ranger of the Night's Watch and a knight from House Rykker.
Jarl is a wildling raider.
Jason Lannister was Lord of Casterly Rock and head of House Lannister during the reigns of Viserys I and Aegon II Targaryen.
Ser Jason Lannister was a knight from House Lannister. He was the fourth and youngest son of Lord Gerold Lannister and his second wife, Lady Rohanne Webber.
Jason Mallister is the Lord of Seagard and head of House Mallister. He has at least one son, Patrek.
Lord Jasper Arryn was the Lord of the Eyrie, Defender of the Vale and Warden of the East. He was the father of Jon, Alys and Ronnel Arryn.
Ser Jasper Redfort is a knight of House Redfort and is the son of Lord Horton Redfort.
Jasper Waynwood  was a member of House Waynwood, the only son of Ser Elys Waynwood and Alys Arryn. He died at the age of three after getting kicked in the head by a horse.

Jasper Wylde, called Ironrod, was Lord of the Rain House and head of House Wylde. He was the master of laws during the reign of Viserys I Targaryen, and the civil war known as the Dance of the Dragons.
Jate is a man-at-arms.
Jate Blackberry is a member of House Blackberry and is the captain of the gate at Dragonstone. He always doffs his cap to passing women.
Jayde is a whore at Chataya's brothel in King's Landing.
Jayne Bracken is the daughter of Lord Jonos Bracken.
Jeffory Mallister was a member of House Mallister.
Ser Jeffory Norcross, better known as Neveryield, was a knight of House Norcross. He was a member of the Kingsguard at an unknown time.
Jeor Mormont, also known as the Old Bear, is the 997th Lord Commander of the Night's Watch, In the television adaptation Game of Thrones, Jeor is played by James Cosmo.<ref name=HBO/>
Jeren is a steward of the Night's Watch. He is the bastard son of a septon.
Jeyne Arryn, called the Maiden of the Vale, was a member of House Arryn and a Lady of the Eyrie. She ruled the Vale of Arryn during the civil war known as the Dance of the Dragons.
Jeyne Beesbury was a member of House Beesbury and the wife of Rhaegar Frey, with whom she had three children, Robert, Walda, and Jonos.

Jeyne Darry is the wife of Ser Cleos Frey, the eldest son of Genna Lannister and Lord Emmon Frey. They have two sons: Tywin "Ty" and Willem Frey. Jeyne's father was the lord of House Darry. She is the younger sister of Mariya Darry.
Jeyne Fossoway is a member of House Fossoway of New Barrel. She is the wife of Ser Gunthor Hightower.
Jeyne Goodbrook is the only daughter of Ser Garse Goodbrook and Kyra Frey.
Jeyne Heddle, called Long Jeyne, is the new innkeep of the Crossroads Inn. She has a younger sister, Willow. She is the niece of Masha Heddle and a collaborator of the Brotherhood Without Banners.

Jeyne Lothston was a member of House Lothston and was the daughter of Lord Lucas Lothston and Lady Falena Stokeworth. She was King Aegon IV Targaryen's eighth mistress, and rumoured to have been possibly fathered by the king himself.
Jeyne Lydden was the second wife of Ser Stevron Frey. They had two children; Aegon and Maegelle Frey. She died of a fall from a horse.
Jeyne Poole is the daughter of the steward of Winterfell, Vayon Poole. She is the best friend of Sansa Stark.
Jeyne Rivers is a natural daughter of Lord Walder Frey.
Lady Jeyne Swann was a member of House Swann.
Jeyne Waters was the bastard daughter of Lord Alyn Velaryon and Princess Elaena Targaryen.

Jeyne Westerling is the eldest daughter of Lord Gawen Westerling and Lady Sybell Spicer. In the television adaptation  Game of Thrones her character is replaced by Talisa Maegyr of Volantis, played by Oona Chaplin.
Queen Jeyne Westerling was a member of House Westerling. She was one of the many wives of King Maegor I Targaryen.
Jhaqo is a ko in the khalasar commanded by Khal Drogo.
Jhiqui is a Dothraki handmaiden of Daenerys Targaryen.
Jhogo is a Dothraki horserider of Daenerys Targaryen's khas who later becomes one of her bloodriders.
Lady Joanna Lannister was a Lady of Casterly Rock, the wife of Lord Tywin Lannister, and the mother of Cersei, Jaime and Tyrion.
Joanna Swyft is a member of House Swyft, the daughter of Ser Steffon Swyft.
Jocelyn Swyft is a member of House Swyft. She is a lady attendant of Queen Cersei Lannister.
Jodge is a squire for Ser Dunaver. He can not hold his water during the night.

Prince Joffrey Baratheon is known to the Seven Kingdoms as the eldest son and heir of King Robert I Baratheon and Queen Cersei Lannister.  A member of House Baratheon of King's Landing, his siblings are Princess Myrcella and Prince Tommen. In the television adaptation Game of Thrones, he is played by Jack Gleeson.

Joffrey Caswell was Lord of Bitterbridge and head of House Caswell during the reign of Aerys I Targaryen. At the time of the Second Blackfyre Rebellion he was twenty years of age. He was thin, a poor rider and even worse lance.
Ser Joffrey Lonmouth, known as the Knight of Kisses, was a knight of House Lonmouth. He was likely a lover to Laenor Velaryon. Joffrey Velaryon was named after him.
Lady Johanna Swann was a niece of the Lord of Stonehelm in the early second century who became an influential courtesan known as the Black Swan in Lys.

Jojen Reed is a member of House Reed. He is Lord Howland Reed's only son and Meera Reed's younger brother. Jojen has greensight, the power of prophetic green dreams. In the HBO adaptation Game of Thrones he is portrayed by Thomas Brodie-Sangster.
Jommo is a khal of a khalasar. He is a sometime ally of Khal Drogo.
Jommy was a man in service to House Baratheon at Storm's End.
Jon Arryn was a head of House Arryn whose titles included Lord of the Eyrie, Defender of the Vale, and Warden of the East. He served as Hand of the King to Robert I Baratheon from
Jon was the husband of Lady Lysa Arryn and father of Lord Robert Arryn, and he acted as a second father to Lord Eddard Stark and King Robert.
Ser Jon Bettley, better known as Beardless Jon Bettley, is a knight of House Bettley.
Jon Brax is the youngest son of Ser Flement Brax and Morya Frey.
Lord Jon Bulwer was Lord of Blackcrown and head of House Bulwer during the reign of Robert Baratheon. He married Victaria Tyrell and had one child with her, Alysanne.
Jon Connington, also known as Griff,
Ser Jon Cupps is a knight of House Cupps. He is married to Leyla Hightower, one of the daughters of Lord Leyton Hightower.
Ser Jon Fossoway is the Knight of New Barrel of the green-apple Fossoways. He is married to Janna Tyrell, the sister of Lord Mace Tyrell.
Ser Jon Heddle, better known as Long Jon Heddle, was a knight who owned the Crossroads Inn. He was crippled.
Ser Jon Hollard was a knight of House Hollard, the steward of Duskendale. He was married to the sister of Lord Denys Darklyn.
Jon Lynderly is the head of House Lynderly and is the Lord of the Snakewood in the Vale.
Jon Myre, better known as Pinchface Jon Myre, is a member of House Myre.
Jon Penny is an orphan boy. Possibly he's a member of House Penny.
Ser Jon Penrose was a knight of House Penrose during the reign of King Daeron II Targaryen.
Jon Pox is the friend of the brother of Septon Meribald. He died in the War of the Ninepenny Kings.
Ser Jon Redfort is a knight of House Redfort and a son of Lord Horton Redfort.
